thing-type.label: Dimmy ZDI5200 Universal light dimmer
thing-type.description: Universal light dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtDIMMY type ZDI5200 is a Z-Wave light dimmer with power metering, the module is designed to be installed in, for example, lamp outlets and thereby making the connected lamp dimmable through the Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gtThe DIMMY module can dim all kind of dimmable light sources from 0 - 250W.</p&gt <p&gtThe built-in power metering can measure the power consumption of the connected load as low as 2W and the metering data, both Watt and kWh, are reported to the Z-Wave Controller.</p&gt <p&gtDIMMY is controlled via Z-Wave commands, for example by Logic Group MATRIX wall switches, and is able to send status-reports back to the switches and thereby be a part of a multi-way switching configuration, where several switches can control the DIMMY module and the switches receives reports about the actual status of the module.</p&gt <p&gtDIMMY is also working as a repeater in the Z-Wave network and therefore expands the Z-Wave network coverage.</p&gt <p&gtDIMMY is a single channel device, which means that all associations to DIMMY must be made as single channel associations.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtAdd DIMMY to a network with Classic Inclusion by triple-pressing on the switch shaped as a power symbol (I) (Figure 4). The LED inside the module will start blinking.</p&gt <p&gtIf DIMMY already belongs to a Z-Wave network, the remove process must be performed before adding it in a new network. Otherwise, the adding of the device will fail.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtRemove DIMMY from a network by triple-pressing on the switch shaped as a power symbol (I) (Figure 4). The LED inside the module will start blinking.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Duration of dimming
parameter.description: Duration of dimming<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter specifies the duration of a full regulation of the light from 0% to 100%. A regulation of the light with 1% will take 1/100 of the specified duration. This is used when the dimming is fulfilled from other Z-Wave devices with a factory default duration.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtImmediately</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 - 127</td&gt <td&gtDuration in seconds. (Default is 5 seconds).</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt128 - 255</td&gt <td&gtDuration in minutes (minus 127) from 1 – 128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Dimmer mode
parameter.description: Dimmer mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe dimmer can work in three different modes: on/off, leading edge or trailing edge.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Dimmer minimum leve
parameter.description: Dimmer minimum leve<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 0%.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 - 99</td&gt <td&gtCorresponds to 0 – 99% (Default is 0)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Dimmer maximum level.
parameter.description: Dimmer maximum level.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 99%.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1-99</td&gt <td&gtCorresponds to 1 – 99% (Default is 99)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Meter report time.
parameter.description: Meter report time.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter specifies how often meter reports are sent via association group 1.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtMeter reports are never sent</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1-127</td&gt <td&gtReport time in seconds. (Default is 60 seconds).</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt128-255</td&gt <td&gtReport time in minutes (minus 127) from 1 – 128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Lifeline<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSends Device Reset notifications, Meter reports and Multilevel Switch reports.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Basic Report
parameter.description: Basic Report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtNodes in this group receives Basic Report with the actual state of the multilevel switch (dimmer). It can be used by MATRIX devices to update their internal pushbutton states and can be used in multi-way switching configurations for ensuring that all controlling devices has an updated status</p&gt
